result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandi L. Simonis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
FOLLOW ALL CONDITIONS OF BROWN COUNTY DRUG COURT, IF ACCEPTED.
IF ACCEPTED INTO DRUG COURT, PROBATION TO BE IN BROWN COUNTY.
IF DEFENDANT IS NOT ACCEPTED INTO DRUG COURT, THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS OF PROBATION APPLY.

miscConds.notes:
Including $80 buy money.
To be repaid during probation.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample today (4-6-16) & pay DNA surcharge.

No alcohol, no illegal drugs, no prescription drugs except those prescribed by a doctor and approved by agent.
No contact with C.M.

Any assessments, counseling and follow through as determined by agent
Defendant must report to probation today.

timeConds.notes: Remaining 85 days to be suspended and to be used by agent during probation as sanctions or as sanctions for the Brown County Drug Court.

Defendant Brandi L. Simonis in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell.  Defendant Brandi L. Simonis in custody.  Kent Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:02am
Court is being heard
Atty Crowell spks on Brown Co. Drug Court--takes a long time to be evaluated by Brown Co., def has not be evaluated there yet
ADA spks- def was not accepted into Marinette County Drug Court
Atty Crowell spks- if def is given probation would like def to remain eligible for Brown Co. Drug Court
Def would like to proceed with sentencing today
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Crowell spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court marks def's letter as exhibit #1
Court imposes:
Ct 1: Imposed and stayed: 18 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision. Eligible for CIP & SAP.
Ct 2: Imposed and stayed: 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision. Eligible for CIP & SAP. Concurrent to Ct 1.
3 years probation:
Pay $100+ costs+ DNA surcharge + $80 buy money-- to be repaid during probation
300 days jail. 215 days credit. Remaining 85 days to be suspended and to be used by agent during probation as sanctions, or as sanctions for the Brown Co. Drug Court
Follow all conditions of Brown Co. Drug Court, if accepted. If accepted probation to be in Brown Co. 
If def not accepted into Drug Court, the follow conditions of probation apply:
Any assessments, counseling and follow through as determined by agent
No alcohol, no illegal drugs, no prescription drugs except those prescribed by a doctor and approved by agent
No contact with C.M
Def must submit DNA sample today
Def must report to Probation today
